asset.caption: Part of the Bridgeton Landfill

date.headline: Fire
date.text: Landfill experiences elevated temperatures, discovery of "subsurface smoldering event" a.k.a. fire.

date.headline: Early Spring, 2012: Indicators rise
date.text: Increased odors noticed and subsidence levels begin to exceed expected levels.

date.headline: April, 2012: Meeting
date.text: Solid Waste and Republic began meeting to discuss the situation. After months, DHSS releases a report indicating concentrations of certain compounds merit additional sampling and corrective actions.

date.headline: Lawsuit
date.text: Attorney General Chris Koster files a lawsuit to ensure Republic Services completes actions to address environmental, odor problems.

date.headline: Capped
date.text: Cap on the landfill South Quarry complete.

date.headline: Radioactivity
date.text: More radioactive material detected at West Lake Landfill.

date.headline: More testing
date.text: Republic vows to expand carbon monoxide testing.

date.headline: EPA: 'Little risk'
date.text: EPA says landfill fire poses little risk.
